name: Vpushup
how_to_perform:
1. Start in a plank position, with your hands shoulder-width apart on the ground and your body forming a straight line from your head to your heels.
2. Engage your core by pulling your belly button towards your spine, ensuring that your hips do not sag or pike upwards throughout the movement.
3. Bring one knee up and outwards in a 45 degree angle, creating a "V" shape with your legs.
4. Lower your body down towards the ground until your chest almost touches the floor, keeping your arms straight.
5. Push back up to the starting position, extending through the tip of your fingers and pressing your torso upwards.
6. Repeat on the other side with the opposite leg.
short_summary: Vpushups are a variation of pushups that targets the chest muscles with an added movement of bringing one knee outwards in a V shape.
